scope

Class AlphabetScope<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • scope.AlphabetScope<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Scope<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CharacterScope

    public class AlphabetScope<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Scope<T>
    Implements Scope, when the set (or alphabet) of possible values is specified by a Set.
    Version:
    October 2019
    Author:
    Hugh Osborne

    • Method Detail

      • contains

        public boolean contains(T value)
        Tests whether the given value is within the scope of this Scope. I.e., is it in the alphabet of this scope.
        Specified by:
        contains in interface Scope<T>
        Parameters:
        value - the value to be checked.
        Returns:
        true iff the value is within the scope of this Scope.

      • getValue

        public T getValue()
        Get a value within the scope of this Scope.
        Specified by:
        getValue in interface Scope<T>
        Returns:
        a random value from this scope's alphabet.

      • size

        public int size()
        How many values are there within this scope?
        Specified by:
        size in interface Scope<T>
        Returns:
        the size of this scope's alphabet..
